item.title: Tasmanian tractor convoy unable to break stalemate on potato farmer pay
item.description: Tasmanian potato farmers have rejected a second pay offer from multinational processor Simplot that would see farmers paid less per kilo than last year.

item.title: Pro-Palestinian protesters told Sydney Opera House 'off-limits' for planned rally
item.description: NSW Police says the location and expected scale of the rally planned by the Palestinian Action Group poses public safety concerns.

item.title: US investigators launch review into 2005 death of journalist and author Hunter S Thompson
item.description: A Colorado sheriff says his office wants to address lingering questions surrounding the author's death.

item.title: Diamonds chasing polished performance against 'confident' Proteas in three-Test series ahead of 2026 Commonwealth Games
item.description: The Diamonds are way of South Africa ahead of their three-Test series, which kicks off in Bendigo on Saturday night.

item.title: Wallabies fall to 28-14 defeat against All Blacks in Bledisloe Cup contest in Perth
item.description: Australia's hopes of an unlikely Rugby Championship triumph have been extinguished with a 28-14 loss to New Zealand.

item.title: Community saves endangered tropical sea turtle that washed up on Esperance beach
item.description: A community has sprung into action to nurse a juvenile tropical turtle back to health as wildlife carers question how it found its way to WA's south coast.

item.title: Tigers end AFLW drought in shock 11-point win over Crows as Blues and Eagles enjoy victories
item.description: Richmond's dismal losing streak is over, with midfielder Monique Conti playing a starring role in a shock win over competition heavyweights Adelaide.

item.title: F1 Singapore Grand Prix: Lando Norris hits Oscar Piastri on first lap, George Russell wins
item.description: Oscar Piastri has been left furious at his teammate, and his team, after his two drivers' championship rivals gained ground on him in the Formula 1 Singapore Grand Prix.

item.title: Vintage cars race on historic Lake Perkolilli track in Red Dust Revival
item.description: A dusty claypan in outback Western Australia is transformed back into a historic race track, as vintage car and motorcycle enthusiasts re-enact races held a century ago.

item.title: As the AFLW begins to even out, North Melbourne remains untouchable
item.description: North Melbourne claims its 20th win in a row as it looks to go undefeated for another season.

item.title: Lando Norris says anyone who criticised his driving after Oscar Piastri incident 'shouldn't be in F1'
item.description: Lando Norris says anyone who criticised his driving at the Singapore Grand Prix "shouldn't be in F1", after Oscar Piastri openly criticised Norris's driving.

item.title: English author Jilly Cooper, writer of The Rutshire Chronicles, dies at age 88
item.description: The author was best known for The Rutshire Chronicles, including the novel Rivals, which was recently adapted into a Disney+ series.

item.title: Bayer announces Roundup alternative with rollout of new weedkiller in Australia
item.description: We've been spraying it on our farms, gardens and roadsides for 50 years, but the world's most used weedkiller is starting to run out of steam.

item.title: Search for missing man Peter Willoughby, 76, continues in Tasmanian bushland
item.description: Mounted crews and drones are now involved in the search for Peter Willoughby, 76, who became disoriented and walked off into dense bushland near Launceston, police say.

item.title: In Trent Dalton's new book Gravity Let Me Go, the bestselling author interrogates himself
item.description: In Gravity Let Me Go, a struggling crime journalist lands the scoop of a lifetime, to the detriment of his loved ones. That's something Trent Dalton understands intimately.

item.title: Body recovered during search for missing 15-year-old swimmer in Tamworth
item.description: A multi-agency search of the Peel River began on Monday night after police were told the teen had entered the water and failed to resurface.

item.title: Planning can help save you money this festive season
item.description: Australians estimate Christmas costs them about $800 a year, on average, but planning ahead can reduce the financial burden.

item.title: Australian wins with a jaffle at World Porridge Making Championship
item.description: An oatmeal-filled jaffle made by a Melbourne food stylist and flavoured with Bundaberg Rum and bananas wins over judges in Scotland.

item.title: Diamonds looking to change things up in second netball Test against South Africa
item.description: Australian coach Stacey Marinkovich says she needs to try different combinations ahead of the Test series against New Zealand.

item.title: When is the 2025 Bathurst 1000? And what weather is forecast for the Supercars on Mount Panorama?
item.description: The 2025 Bathurst 1000 gets underway this weekend. Here's all you need to know before the 68th running of the iconic endurance race.

item.title: Sheffield Shield round one quick hits: Marnus Labuschagne enjoys timely century while Ashes Test hopefuls struggle
item.description: The Sheffield Shield is underway, with all eyes on the contenders for Australia's problematic opener spot. Here are five quick hits from the opening round of the season.

item.title: Saltwater crocodile found with mouth zip-tied shut in Adelaide River, sparking calls for stronger penalties
item.description: The discovery of a saltwater crocodile with its mouth bound shut by zip ties in a Darwin river has sparked outrage, with animal rights advocates calling for stronger wildlife protections.

item.title: Players concerned over Shanghai heat as Novak Djokovic collapses on court
item.description: Holger Rune says "there is always a limit" as soaring temperatures and humidity in Shanghai and Wuhan tennis events cause player distress.

item.title: Australian merino wool future positive after surging price restores grower confidence
item.description: Amid a run of price rises at Australian wool auctions, the next generation of growers say global demand and fresh confidence could mark a turning point for the fibre.

item.title: Australians are reading less than ever before. Here's how to read more books
item.description: Research shows Australians are reading fewer books than ever before. One writer shares her advice on how to make reading a daily habit.

item.title: Broken Hill nurse to represent Australia at Ironman World Championship — Women
item.description: Broken Hill nurse Bella Kolinac, 23, will represent Australia at the Ironman World Championship — Women in Kona, Hawaii.

item.title: AFLW Carlton star Darcy Vescio says 'punching down' on Mad Monday must end
item.description: Inaugural Carlton AFLW star Darcy Vescio has urged players to be more conscious of their role-model status when dressing up for end-of-season celebrations.

item.title: Trade restrictions for Philippines banana imports to be reviewed by federal government
item.description: The federal government will review its quarantine rules after a formal request by the Philippines to import its bananas, but the industry is pushing back.

item.title: Strava is suing Garmin for patent infringement. Here's what we know
item.description: Fitness app Strava and sports watchmaker Garmin usually go hand-in-hand, but the two fitness tech leaders are now in competition in a US lawsuit.

item.title: Do dishwashers release microplastics when you wash plastic containers and kitchenware?
item.description: If you're worried about microplastics, is it safe to wash plastic containers and other utensils in the dishwasher, given the use of heat and detergents? We asked two experts.

item.title: Myanmar's military uses paraglider to bomb festival and anti-junta protest
item.description: People were gathering for the festival and an anti-junta demonstration when bombs killed at least 20 people and injured dozens more.

item.title: Domain rental report for September quarter shows rent for houses stable across combined capital cities
item.description: Domain's September quarterly report shows house rents across the country's combined capitals have remained stable for five consecutive quarters.

item.title: Endometriosis sufferers battling to manage pain as system struggles to cope
item.description: Women suffering from the chronic pain associated with endometriosis have called for more government investment into understanding the condition, with an expert warning the mental effects can be just as debilitating as the physical symptoms.

item.title: How reading romance has helped keep the spark alive for this couple
item.description: After 10 years of marriage and two kids, Joseph Heath and wife Laura are still in the "honeymoon phase". He says romance novels are a large part of why.

item.title: How drought inspired Goondiwindi's thriving art movement
item.description: Goondiwindi's Lanescape art collective transforms the Queensland border town into an open-air gallery featuring large steel sculptures.

item.title: Competition watchdog approves Elders' $475m acquisition of agribusiness rival Delta
item.description: The consumer watchdog has given the go-ahead for Elders to acquire its competitor, Delta, but it must sell six Delta stores in WA to improve competition.

item.title: The US sees Pacific Islands as 'tip of the spear', but locals fear becoming China's 'bullseye'
item.description: The United States is spending billions of dollars muscling up across its Pacific Island military outposts, but locals fear their peaceful islands will become a target.

item.title: Rain causes crashes during first Bathurst 1000 practice sessions on Mount Panorama
item.description: Supercars heavyweights Triple Eight lead the charge into the Bathurst 1000 with one eye on the trophy and another on the weather forecast.

item.title: Novak Djokovic advances to Shanghai Masters semifinals, qualifier Valentin Vacherot continues fairytale run
item.description: Fourth seed Novak Djokovic battled past a spirited Zizou Bergs 6-3 7-5 on Thursday to reach the Shanghai Masters semifinals for a 10th time, setting up a clash with surprise package and world number 204 Valentin Vacherot.

item.title: Indonesia urges respect for its sovereignty after Australia-PNG defence treaty
item.description: The landmark agreement commits both countries to "meet the common danger" in the event of an armed attack on either. With that, questions have been raised about Australia's role if the conflict in West Papua escalates.

item.title: What NSW court ruling on Sydney Opera House pro-Palestinian march means for future protests
item.description: The state's three top judges have ruled to block a pro-Palestinian march at the Sydney Opera House this weekend, but experts say an element of their decision sets a precedent that could have major implications on protests going forward.

item.title: Cairns faces prospect of water restrictions at wettest time of year
item.description: Cairns residents are urged to cut down on their water use as multiple infrastructure failures put the city at risk of water shortfalls heading into summer.

item.title: Can you ever throw out a previous home owner or renter's mail?
item.description: Even years after moving in, you might still be receiving someone else’s bills and letters. Here’s what can you do about it.

item.title: Donna Nelson drops attempts to overturn Japan drug smuggling conviction
item.description: A Perth grandmother duped into becoming a drug mule in an elaborate love scam abandons her final line of appeal on drug importing charges in Japan.

item.title: Former Olympic basketballer Danny Morseu 'disappointed' retrial abandoned
item.description: Danny Morseu's conviction has been wiped but he says he will struggle to find a job, a home, and a source of income after Queensland's Director of Public Prosecutions decided not to pursue a retrial.

item.title: Memories from the rubble
item.description: When 25-year-old Nour imagines herself back home in Gaza City, she remembers the things that made her smile. Now that's all gone.

item.title: AI-generated images of missing 4yo Gus raise legal concerns about misinformation
item.description: The thought of a missing boy lost in the outback is indescribably harrowing — but what's almost as disturbing is the realisation that some on social media have seized on the disappearance of four-year-old Gus as an opportunity to spread misinformation.

item.title: Alex de Minaur loses 6-4, 6-4 to Daniil Medvedev in Shanghai quarterfinals to miss out on career milestone
item.description: Alex de Minaur is eliminated from the Shanghai Masters, going down 6-4, 6-4 to former world number one Danil Medvedev in the quarterfinals, denying the 26-year-old Australian a chance of his 300th tour win.

item.title: Soccer the name of the game in Borroloola, even reigning over Australian Rules Football
item.description: Aussie Rules football is life for many in remote NT Aboriginal communities but in Borroloola, barefoot young women and girls dream of following their hero into soccer's A-League.

item.title: Big Bathurst 1000 barrel roll sparks safety car as SuperUtes driver walks away
item.description: Dave Casey rolls his Mitsubishi Triton twice on race two of the V8 SuperUte Series at the Bathurst 1000, but walks away from the incident.

item.title: Kimberley woman part of Seven Sisters project makes submission to UN in fight for justice
item.description: It has been close to three decades since Irene Davey's daughter disappeared. Now she is taking her case to the United Nations in an attempt to finally get justice.

item.title: Roaring jet boats to return to Victoria for first time in 15 years
item.description: From tractors to jet boats at Elmore, as Victoria prepares to host Australian series jet boat event in 2026.

item.title: Brodie Kostecki claims third straight Bathurst 1000 pole after dominating Top-10 Shootout
item.description: Brodie Kostecki claims pole at the Bathurst 1000, becoming just the third driver in Supercars history to start at the top of the grid three years in a row.

item.title: A new supermarket has been invited to Australia. Here's what that might mean
item.description: Last month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese invited Emirati hypermarket chain LuLu Group to compete with Coles and Woolworths for market share. But some retail experts say entry into Australia's supermarket sector isn't so simple.

item.title: Albanese government's BetStop scheme not working, former gambler says
item.description: Diehard Richmond fan "Tiger Shaun" says he's watched on in horror as gambling advertising and sponsorships have come to dominate football — and become a constant reminder of the addiction he has struggled with.

item.title: What time is the 2025 Bathurst 1000? How can I watch the Supercars at Bathurst?
item.description: The 2025 Bathurst 1000 starts on Sunday morning. Here's all you need to know before the 68th running of the iconic endurance race.

item.title: Gregory Porter on turning personal pain into powerful music
item.description: From the pain of racism to the joy of love, Gregory Porter's voice carries it all with power and purpose.

item.title: Roads in WA's East Pilbara need millions of dollars in repairs eight months after Cyclone Zelia
item.description: Australia's largest shire says it needs state and federal support to repair roads damaged during a cyclone, which provide a "lifeline" to remote communities.

item.title: Kelpies for Kids fundraiser at Perth Royal Show raises nearly $50k for sick children
item.description: A working dog auction at the Perth Royal Show raises nearly $50,000 for charity Telethon to support sick children.

item.title: From The Godfather to The First Wives Club — here are Diane Keaton's best films
item.description: With a career beginning in the late 1970s, Diane Keaton would star in more than 100 films and earn several Oscar nods.

item.title: Police search for man who disappeared during camping trip with wife in Victoria's east
item.description: Police are appealing to the public for help in locating a man who left to pick up supplies while camping with his wife in Gippsland.

item.title: Thousands join pro-Palestinian rallies in towns and cities across Australia amid ceasefire
item.description: The rallies in cities and towns dubbed the Nationwide Rally for Palestine come less than a week after the second anniversary of the October 7 terrorist attack.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds defeat South Africa's Proteas 65-42 in third netball Test
item.description: Australia warms up for the eagerly anticipated Constellation Cup with a convincing 65-42 victory over South Africa in the third and final Test in Adelaide.

item.title: Bathurst 1000 quick hits: Chaz Mostert drinks beer with fans, Erebus owner protests, and drama on Mount Panorama
item.description: Wild weather and hard racing were combined with bold and colourful personalities to create a truly memorable day of Supercars racing. Here are the quick hits from the 2025 Bathurst 1000.

item.title: Vacherot becomes lowest-ranked ATP Masters winner after defeating his cousin Rinderknech in Shanghai
item.description: He beat his cousin Arthur Rinderknech 4-6, 6-3, 6-3 on Sunday local time to claim the first title of his career after a stunning run from the qualifying rounds.

item.title: WA lawyers write to attorney-general calling for in-person court hearings to return to remote Balgo
item.description: With in-person court hearings suspended and video links cancelled, lawyers are struggling to ensure access to justice for the remote community of Balgo.

item.title: Mount Magnet Shire councillor Ian Black suspended after no apology for defamatory notice
item.description: Mount Magnet Shire deputy president Ian Black is suspended after failing to apologise for posting a defamatory notice about staff to a public noticeboard.

item.title: World's biggest light installation to illuminate landscapes of Albany, WA
item.description: A light installation, projected onto King George Sound in Albany, will be the largest ever created.

item.title: How to tell if your Qantas personal data has hit the dark web and what you can do if it has
item.description: Hackers have released Qantas customer data onto the dark web. Here's what experts say to look out for if you think your personal data may be caught up in the leak and what actions you can take.

item.title: Pink Elephants report highlights care gaps for rural women experiencing miscarriages
item.description: Pregnancy loss is a lottery determined by location, according to a report that has sparked calls for the federal government to improve care for women who experience miscarriage in regional and rural communities.

item.title: Police resume search for missing boy Gus in South Australia's outback
item.description: SA Police and ADF personnel will resume their search for missing four-year-old Gus in South Australia's mid-north tomorrow.

item.title: Here's how Labor's revised super proposal would work
item.description: Every prominent criticism of the tax has been addressed, with the result that it will apply to fewer people and raise less money.

item.title: Shire of Coolgardie avoids suspension following 'serious concern' over financial management
item.description: A debt-laden shire in WA's Goldfields has avoided being suspended over mismanagement allegations.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds mindful they need to lift against New Zealand's Silver Ferns in Constellation Cup
item.description: Despite the comfortable series win over South Africa, Australia is mindful it will need to step up a gear in the Constellation Cup against New Zealand.

item.title: Queensland council loses $2 million in alleged international fraud incident
item.description: Noosa Council alleges it was targeted by "international criminal gangs" in December last year.

item.title: Why Santos is behind your soaring electricity and mortgage costs
item.description: It was a primary force behind Australia’s inflationary surge, it’s forced businesses either to the wall or to shift offshore, undermined national industry policy and resulted in the loss of countless thousands of jobs. And it all hinged on one disastrous decision in an Adelaide boardroom.

item.title: Taskforce launched as search for Gus expands in SA's mid-north
item.description: As SA Police and the Australian Defence Force resume their search for missing four-year-old Gus in South Australia's arid mid-north, authorities have announced a new taskforce.

item.title: Generator trial to address mobile phone tower outages during WA emergencies
item.description: Rural communities battling power cuts to mobile towers during natural disasters are being offered a temporary solution with a trial of community-operated generators.

item.title: Plans for national art gallery in Alice Springs scrapped after government rift
item.description: The Northern Territory government scraps controversial plans to build the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Gallery of Australia in Alice Springs after nine years of back and forth.

item.title: Madagascar's president flees country on French plane amid student protests
item.description: Andry Rajoelina flees the country amid widespread protests that saw an elite military unit join demonstrators in opposing the government.

item.title: Paul Kelly on the songs that inspire him
item.description: As the 70-year-old songwriter prepares his 30th album, he talks about the music that has driven him creatively.

item.title: Parts of Coffs Coast Wildlife Sanctuary evacuated due to 'highly venomous' sea snake
item.description: Visitors to a northern New South Wales wildlife sanctuary were forced to evacuate after a woman brought in a rescued sea snake, one of the world's deadliest reptiles.

item.title: Indie film producers tell SXSW Sydney about how to survive and thrive making horror
item.description: Horror films can be a great training ground for filmmakers, but there is also a gritty reality, a panel of indie producers tells SXSW Sydney.

item.title: NSW Parramatta Council CEO breaks silence after late-night sacking
item.description: Nine councillors voted in favour of firing Gail Connolly, while three voted against the move and three abstained.

item.title: LNP government criticised over new 'jobs for mates' appointment of party powerbroker
item.description: Queensland's Crisafulli government is embroiled in a new "jobs for mates" claim after it appointed a Liberal National Party powerbroker to oversee the state's lead agency for disaster recovery.

item.title: Why does SA have a summer plan for the algal bloom and what's in it?
item.description: The full details of South Australia's algal bloom summer plan which aims to ensure South Australians can "enjoy their summer" were released yesterday. The plan includes measures to protect the state's coast while supporting businesses and communities.

item.title: Tasmania's fashion industry fears TasTAFE course cuts will impact creative pathways
item.description: Under planned government cuts to vocational training in Tasmania, young aspiring creatives are worried about a loss of opportunity in their home state.

item.title: Grammy-winning R&B singer D'Angelo dies of cancer aged 51
item.description: The Untitled (How Does It Feel) singer died after a long struggle with cancer, his family said.

item.title: Coroner makes rare public statement as NSW records most Indigenous deaths in custody in a year
item.description: NSW Coroner Teresa O'Sullivan's rare public comment on the "entrenched over-representation" of Indigenous prisoners as the state records the most ever in a single year, is welcomed by the grieving family member of a man who died in prison.

item.title: Copper Coast Council threatens ratepayer with legal action over 'offensive' comment
item.description: Parking on South Australia's Copper Coast is a hot-button issue with one resident saying he is "prepared to go to court" over comments made about council staff, which have been labelled "offensive" and "threatening".

item.title: Regional Victorian farmers left high and dry as decent spring rain fails to arrive
item.description: Some Victorian farmers are cutting crops for hay as the drought continues to bite in the nation's south-east.

item.title: Illawarrra Academy of Sport holds open testing day for aspiring young athletes
item.description: Young athletes wanting to be the next Emma McKeon or Jessica Hull have been put through high-performance testing to see if they have what it takes to be a professional.

item.title: Japan makes history as Brazil records 'unacceptable' 3-2 loss in international friendly
item.description: For the first time in 14 meetings, Japan defeats Brazil 3-2 in their international friendly at a sold-out Tokyo Stadium.

item.title: England thrashes Latvia 5-0 to qualify for World Cup finals
item.description: Unbeaten in its qualifying matches, England reaches next year's World Cup finals following a dominant 5-0 defeat of Latvia.

item.title: Randa Abdel-Fattah reveals how the Israel-Gaza war shaped her new book Discipline
item.description: Randa Abdel-Fattah explores the experience of Palestinian Australians in Discipline, her first book for adults.

item.title: Socceroos lose 2-1 to USA in international friendly, ending Tony Popovic's unbeaten start
item.description: The Socceroos suffer defeat for the first time under Tony Popovic, falling to a 2-1 defeat against the USA in Colorado.

item.title: Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2025 winners list: Spiders, frogs and fungi
item.description: An Australian photographer who took a unique shot of a skeletoniser caterpillar is among the winners.

item.title: AFL trade period, deadline day recap: Zach Merrett stuck at Essendon as Charlie Curnow and Christian Petracca find new homes
item.description: The clock runs out on deadline day of the AFL trade period, with Hawthorn failing to seal a deal for Zach Merrett, while the Swans hand over a raft of picks to clinch a move for Charlie Curnow.

item.title: Search continues for missing bushwalker Daryl Fong in Tasmania's Mount Field National Park
item.description: Tasmania Police Inspector Luke Horne says gale force winds and deep snows are slowing search crews on day three but they still hold out hope.

item.title: Powerhouse misses opportunity to get Melbourne-bound drums of Sydney's Midnight Oil
item.description: Midnight Oil are Sydney rock royalty, but the drum kit that stuck with the band for more than 40 years is heading to a Melbourne music museum.

item.title: CCC investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson finished, but unreleased
item.description: A crime and corruption investigation into former Townsville mayor Troy Thompson has been finished, weeks away from a by-election he is expected to contest.

item.title: Federal government puts states, territories on notice over failure to close the gap for Indigenous people
item.description: The federal Indigenous minister may impose penalties on states and territories that fail to meet critical targets for the National Agreement on Closing the Gap.

item.title: Australia's baby recession deepens, new ABS data says
item.description: The baby recession in Australia is deepening as cost of living pressures make the decision for people to have children less of a choice.

item.title: Three Australian men accused of killing Zivan Radmanovic in Bali could face death penalty
item.description: Indonesian police allege Zivan Radmanovic was killed when two Australian men stormed the villa, shooting him.

item.title: Residents in WA's north urged to prepare for cyclone season
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says it will no longer publish a cyclone outlook for WA's north, saying it was less reliable due to a changing climate.

item.title: Syria's president Sharaa tells Putin he will respect all past deals with Moscow
item.description: Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa has told Russian President Vladimir Putin he would honour all past deals struck between his country and Moscow, a pledge suggesting Moscow's two main military bases in Syria are safe.

item.title: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to temporary ceasefire after deadly violence along border
item.description: A 48-hour ceasefire has been decided between the Pakistan government and the Afghan Taliban regime.

item.title: Madagascar military coup leader Michael Randrianirina 'taking the position of president'
item.description: Colonel Michael Randrianirina led a rebellion by soldiers that ousted President Andry Rajoelina after weeks of youth-led protests against the government.

item.title: Fresh new faces campaigning to make a difference in Melbourne's north as part of youth council
item.description: Melbourne's Hume Council will see the city's first-ever democratically elected youth mayor take office.

item.title: AFL trade period quick hits: Zach Merrett's agent fumes, clubs feud over Callum Ah Chee deal and Charlie Curnow gets his move
item.description: The AFL trade period's deadline day delivered more drama than ever — with a manager blowing up and a Hawks star suggesting Essendon is 'Alcatraz' on a social media post.

item.title: Fifty years since the Balibo Five murders, families are still seeking justice
item.description: On the 50th anniversary of the Balibo Five murders, families are still grieving the loss of their loved ones and remain committed to holding those responsible accountable for their actions.

item.title: Third day of renewed search for missing 4yo Gus wraps up amid extreme heat
item.description: More than 100 people, including from SA Police, the Australian Defence Force, and the State Emergency Services, have been walking about 20 kilometres per day in hot conditions during the renewed search, police say. The search concluded about midday on Thursday.

item.title: England saved by rain in Pakistan World Cup match as Australia prepares to face Bangladesh
item.description: Only a rain downpour against Pakistan prevents England from recording its first defeat of the World Cup, as Australia looks to book its berth in knockout stages.

item.title: Madura Plains sheep station hits the market as wool and lamb prices soar
item.description: One of Australia's largest sheep stations is listed for sale as wool and lamb prices soar.

item.title: NSW Supreme Court finds protest law amendments invalid after Palestine Action Group challenge
item.description: The Palestine Action Group has won a NSW Supreme Court challenge against a law that limited protests near places of worship.

item.title: Kingston residents rally to save 130yo oak tree from transmission project
item.description: Residents are getting creative in their fight to save a "magnificent" 130-year-old Algerian oak tree from being felled for a controversial transmission line project in western Victoria.

item.title: Remains of missing Victorian woman Lucinda Miller discovered in police search
item.description: New information from a member of the local community has led police to human remains in bushland in Victoria's east believed to be missing woman Lucinda Miller.

item.title: Ariarne Titmus labelled a 'living legend' after calling time on decorated swimming career
item.description: Olympic teammates and rivals pay tribute to the career of Australian swimming great Ariarne Titmus, who has announced her retirement at the age of 25.

item.title: Endangered regent honeyeaters released in Hunter breeding effort
item.description: Dozens of regent honeyeaters have been released in woodlands in the NSW Hunter Valley in an effort to boost the critically endangered population.

item.title: Hope at last for families as NSW backs inquiry into unsolved murders
item.description: The NSW Parliament has backed an inquiry into decades of unsolved murders and missing persons cases, following a campaign led by Illawarra families.

item.title: Curators among 45 full-time jobs to be axed in Art Gallery of NSW cuts
item.description: Leaked documents show curators and conservator jobs will go as 45 full-time roles are cut from the Art Gallery of NSW.

item.title: Essendon CEO says Hawthorn AFL trade tactics for Zach Merrett were surprising
item.description: Essendon chief executive Craig Vozzo says the club was surprised Hawthorn waited until late in the AFL trade period to make an offer for their captain, Zach Merrett.

item.title: Mark Haines inquest hears differing opinions from detectives on teen's mysterious death
item.description: Thirty seven years after his death, police still cannot agree on how 17-year-old Mark Haines came to be found on train tracks near Tamworth.

item.title: Diane Keaton's family releases cause of death, urging tributes to homelessness services and animal shelters
item.description: The actor's family says the 79-year-old died of pneumonia, expressing gratitude for the "extraordinary messages of love and support" received following news of her passing.

item.title: Release of Virginia Giuffre's memoir renews sex allegations against Prince Andrew
item.description: Extracts from Virginia Giuffre's posthumously released memoir have further intensified the recently renewed scrutiny on Prince Andrew.

item.title: Tasma Walton and Robbie Arnott share $100,000 ARA Historical Novel Prize
item.description: Robbie Arnott's Dusk about twins hunting a puma in Tasmania, and Tasma Walton's I Am Nannertgarrook about an Aboriginal woman kidnapped and sold into slavery, have tied to win the ARA Historical Novel Prize.

item.title: Government unveils a plan to combat South Australian algal bloom
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Israel claims killing Houthi military chief of staff in strikes on rebel group leaders
item.description: An Israeli air strike targeting top leaders in Yemen's Houthi rebels in August killed its military's chief of staff, officials say, further escalating the tensions between the group and Israel even as a ceasefire holds in Gaza.

item.title: Calls for Australia to follow England's ban on supermarket junk food specials
item.description: Research finding supermarkets continue to offer discounts and multi-buy deals on junk food more frequently than healthy food prompts calls for Australia to follow England's lead and ban "buy one, get one free" deals.

item.title: Oil leaking from WW2 shipwreck the Rio de Janeiro Maru in Chuuk
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: WWII shipwrecks a 'ticking time bomb' for Federated States of Micronesia
item.description: The Federated States of Micronesia's biggest tourism asset has become one of its largest threats, with as much as 22 million litres of oil from World War II shipwrecks slowly leaking into the ocean.

item.title: 'Dangerously low' funding to Tasmanian arts sector creating reputational damage, minister warned
item.description: "Dangerously low" arts sector funding has rendered the Tasmanian industry "highly vulnerable", with funding stagnant since 2016-17, the state government has conceded.

item.title: Jim Chalmers and Tony Burke are in a long race for prime position
item.description: There is general agreement in Labor that Jim Chalmers is the government's best communicator. But insiders watching this race know Tony Burke is the master tactician.

item.title: Expanded search for Gus ends as missing persons advocate speaks out
item.description: SA Police and ADF personnel have concluded a four-day renewed search for four-year-old Gus, as a missing persons advocate speaks out about the emotional impact of such cases on all families who have experienced the disappearance of a loved one.

item.title: Specialist health services shortfall for women in regional WA leave many struggling for support
item.description: Faced with a lack of specialist women's health services, women in regional WA are researching their own conditions and volunteering to raise awareness.

item.title: Younger candidates out to bring change in WA local government elections
item.description: In the last local government elections in WA, the average age of candidates running for councils was 53 years old — but these young candidates are keen to lower that figure.

item.title: Donald Trump says he will meet with Vladimir Putin 'within two weeks or so'
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Ace Frehley, founding member of rock group KISS, dies at 74
item.description: The original lead guitarist of the glam rock band captivated audiences with his elaborate makeup and smoke-filled guitar.

item.title: Australian swimming star Ariarne Titmus says she lost 'fire in the belly' before shock retirement call
item.description: Ariarne Titmus has spoken publicly for the first time after abruptly retiring from professional swimming at just 25, revealing the reasons behind her decision.

item.title: Southern Mallee Council mayor found by ombudsman to have engaged in misconduct
item.description: The South Australian ombudsman says Southern Mallee Council Mayor Ron Valentine improperly used his position to gain an advantage for himself in the recruitment of a CEO in 2023.

item.title: How wild bird poo testing in northern Australia is helping keep eggs on the shelves
item.description: Hundreds of kilometres from the nearest supermarket, Indigenous rangers in Australia's remote north are working to keep eggs on your breakfast table.

item.title: Indigiearth founder inspires Indigenous women to chase business dreams
item.description: Sharon Winsor is honoured for her pioneering work in native Australian cuisine.

item.title: US dangled threat of Tomahawks for Ukraine, then Russia called to negotiate
item.description: US President Donald Trump threatened to send Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine if Russia did not return to peace talks, but analysts say the long-range weapons are not the game-changer they are made out to be.

item.title: Cameron Green ruled out of Australia vs India ODI series, Marnus Labuschagne called into squad
item.description: Cameron Green has been ruled out of Australia's ODI series against India, just over a month out from the start of the Ashes series against England.

item.title: Australia Test batter Nic Maddinson reveals testicular cancer diagnosis
item.description: Former Australia batter Nic Maddinson has revealed he underwent chemotherapy for testicular cancer.

item.title: Video of attempted strip search that breached Aboriginal woman's human rights made public
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Video released of moments leading up to strip search that breached Aboriginal woman's human rights
item.description: The ACT Supreme Court has made public confronting video showing the moments leading up to a strip search that violated an Aboriginal woman’s human rights.

item.title: Grimmer family sets parliamentary privilege deadline for cold case identity
item.description: A brother of three-year-old Cheryl Grimmer, who vanished in 1970, has given the man who confessed to her killing a deadline to come forward or be named.

item.title: Phillip Island lap record smashed by Marco Bezzecchi in MotoGP practice
item.description: In a stunning performance in perfect conditions on Friday, Marco Bezzecchi became the first MotoGP rider to go under 1.27 at the regional Victorian track.

item.title: AFLW Round 10: Port Adelaide Power defeat Hawthorn Hawks, West Coast Eagles down Geelong Cats
item.description: Port Adelaide defeats Hawthorn to record its fourth win of the AFLW season, while West Coast moves closer to a maiden finals appearance with victory over Geelong.

item.title: Adelaide United defeats Sydney FC 2-1, Brisbane downs Macarthur on A-League Men opening night
item.description: Adelaide United begins its season with a 2-1 win over Sydney, while Brisbane coach Michael Valkanis sees son Dimitri sent off in the Roar's 1-0 defeat of Macarthur.

item.title: Albanese's Trump meeting comes amid global geopolitical circus
item.description: All signs suggest Anthony Albanese will be sticking with Plan A in his meeting with the US president on Tuesday, rather than becoming a prop for the bigger global circus.

item.title: Video appears to show March for Australia organiser coordinating with Neo-Nazi
item.description: A previously unreported video has emerged appearing to show a key March for Australia organiser coordinating with a Neo-Nazi at the first rally in Sydney in August, ABC NEWS Verify has found.

item.title: Ange Postecoglou defends record as pressure builds at Nottingham Forest
item.description: Amid growing pressure of his poor start at Nottingham Forest, Ange Postecoglou delivers a five-minute defence of his record as a manager.

item.title: Fire authorities warn of 'above average' fire season as NSW starts to warm up
item.description: Fire authorities warn of above average fire season in NSW despite previous modelling showing a wet summer.

item.title: Renewed search for Gus concludes without answers
item.description: When police announced a new search for a missing four-year-old earlier this week, it came with a renewed hope for answers. But the latest search came to an end on Friday with crews finding no sign of little Gus.

item.title: Trump 'risking full-fledged war' against Venezuela as US military action escalates
item.description: The US military has launched six strikes on Venezuelan vessels the Trump administration claims were involved in drugs trafficking, and some are warning the intervention is threatening to spark an all-out war.

item.title: Protesters clash with police as Bangladesh's political parties agree to pathway for reform
item.description: Tear gas and stun grenades were used to disperse hundreds of protesters who were calling for more provisions for those who helped oust the former government of Sheikh Hasina.

item.title: Lack of housing in remote NT community Borroloola forcing families off country
item.description: Remote NT residents are calling on the government to fund new housing in the Gulf community of Borroloola, fearing limited access to appropriate homes has forced families to move off country.

item.title: A few simple questions reveal the games adults aren't brave enough to play
item.description: This game revealed how rarely we are vulnerable in front of our children, and in front of each other.

item.title: The face of Brisbane is changing — but should thousands of homes be developed in a flood zone?
item.description: Plans to build a riverfront precinct in a flood-prone area of Brisbane have urban planners and locals wary.

item.title: Pakistani soldiers killed by suicide bomb near Afghanistan border
item.description: The attack on a military base near the Afghanistan border comes as Taliban and Pakistani officials say a peace deal has been extended.

item.title: Greek-inspired lamb kebabs with olive potatoes baked in the oven - ABC News
item.description: The lamb is fuss-free and full of flavour. No barbecue needed — the oven takes care of everything.

item.title: From a Springsteen biopic to a doggy horror: here are the movies out in October
item.description: From the highly anticipated Bruce Springsteen biopic to a horror movie from the viewpoint of the family pup, here are the films filling up cinemas in October.

item.title: Cool weather prescribed burn on WA's south coast should be expanded, environmental group says
item.description: The success of a small, autumn prescribed burn on WA's south coast has prompted calls to replace the regular program to reduce environmental damage.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Max Verstappen claims sprint pole ahead of Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri at US F1 Grand Prix
item.description: Max Verstappen topples McLaren pair Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris to claim pole position for the sprint race at the United States Grand Prix.

item.title: Prince Andrew's decision to give up his titles may have been quietly orchestrated by members of his own family
item.description: With the swirl of news around Prince Andrew this week, something had to be done; the question was whether he would do it himself or if his brother would be forced to show him the door.

item.title: After Ukraine, Finland hopes it won't be Putin's next target
item.description: Blasted into the bedrock, deep below the streets of Helsinki, these massive bunkers are currently used for recreation. Their primary function, however, is much more sinister: preparing for a Russian invasion.

item.title: China's 'special forces'-style tourists packing big itineraries in small budgets
item.description: Young Chinese tourists with limited time and money are travelling 'special forces'-style — inspired by the efficiency, endurance, and intensity of military units.

item.title: Aussie Bird Count brings together students, photographers and nature-lovers
item.description: A primary school teacher is getting her students involved in a volunteer-led bird count, to gather a snapshot of birds across the country.

item.title: Flood mapping is different between councils, but one resident is calling for change
item.description: Ben Parkinson is proud of the five acres he calls home in south-east Queensland, but what is missing is the ability to develop his land.

item.title: It's been called Canberra's 'forever government' — but ACT Labor's brand is growing tired
item.description: It's been a year since Canberrans re-elected an ACT Labor government for a seventh consecutive term — but as budget pressures bite, analysts say Labor's stocks are suffering from brand fatigue.

item.title: 3rd Battalion pays tribute to Lance Corporal Tulsa Rumney who died during training near Townsville
item.description: The 3rd Battalion (3RAR) is remembering Lance Corporal Tulsa Rumney who died during training as a passionate and proud Australian who will be forever missed.

item.title: Ange Postecoglou's Nottingham Forest stint a classic case of wrong place, wrong time
item.description: Ange Postecolgou was on a hiding to nothing at Nottingham Forest, his sacking the result of terrible recruitment and a knee-jerk appointment.

item.title: Pakistan and Afghanistan agree to immediate ceasefire after peace talks in Doha
item.description: A week of fierce border clashes has seen the worst violence between the two countries since the Taliban seized power in Kabul in 2021.

item.title: 'Green bans' saved Sydney's historic buildings and taught economists a lesson
item.description: The "green bans" in the 1970s saved many of Australia's historic buildings and our cities are richer for them. But a famous economist didn't like them.

item.title: Australian Para Triathlon mixed relay team seal silver at World Triathlon Championship Finals
item.description: Australia's para triathlon mixed relay team sealed a successful week by claiming a sensational silver medal on the final morning of the World Triathlon Championship Finals in Wollongong.

item.title: Anti-immigration rallies and counter protests held across the country with lower numbers — as it happened
item.description: Demonstrators gathered in cities across the country today, with March for Australia rallies sparking counter protests.

item.title: Mollie O'Callaghan crushes 200m short course world record as post-Titmus era begins
item.description: Mollie O'Callghan breaks the women's short course 200m freestyle world record on day two of the World Aquatics Swimming World Cup second leg in Illinois.

item.title: Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe wins the Top 100 Books countdown — as it happened
item.description: Trent Dalton's debut novel Boy Swallows Universe has won Radio National's Top 100 Books of the 21st Century countdown.

item.title: Missing bushwalker Daryl Fong's brother thanks crews as search continues in 'dangerous' conditions
item.description: Rescue crews have faced challenging conditions in the search for Daryl Fong, who has been missing in Tasmania's Mount Field National Park since last Sunday.

item.title: How Claire's decision to be 'one and done' was rocked by divorce
item.description: After a traumatic birth, followed by mental and physical health challenges, Claire was "one and done". But divorce made her think twice about her decision.

item.title: The story of the 1970 West Gate Bridge disaster features in Melbourne Theatre Company's 2026 season
item.description: The people impacted by Australia's worst industrial disaster are at the centre of West Gate by Dennis McIntosh, one of seven new Australian plays coming to Melbourne Theatre Company in 2026.

item.title: Bruce Reynolds to remain City of Perth Lord Mayor as counting continues in WA local government elections
item.description: Bruce Reynolds has held onto the title of City of Perth Lord Mayor, while early figures from WA's local government elections show voter turnout is below what authorities hoped for.

item.title: Wadeye traditional owners say Yidiyi cultural festival brings community together as 'one family'
item.description: Traditional owners of the remote NT Aboriginal community of Wadeye say the community has been brought "together as one family" at this year's Yidiyi cultural festival.

item.title: More than $6 million of cocaine and methylamphetamine seized during vehicle stop in southern NSW
item.description: Highway patrol stopped the black luxury SUV on a major New South Wales highway for a random drug and alcohol test on Friday afternoon.

item.title: Bulldogs keep finals hopes alive with 66-point Suns trouncing, Lions and Tigers pick up wins
item.description: The Western Bulldogs hammer Gold Coast by 66 points to keep their finals flame flickering, while Brisbane returns to the top four with victory over Essendon.

item.title: Tensions erupt on Melbourne streets as opposing immigration rallies held across Australian capitals
item.description: Two Victoria Police officers were hospitalised after violent clashes, while protesters were also arrested following scuffles in Canberra.

item.title: Raúl Fernández wins Australian MotoGP as Jack Miller fails to finish
item.description: Raúl Fernández breaks through for his first MotoGP win, but Australian Jack Miller's race ends in agony at Phillip Island.

item.title: Possible space junk found near Western Australian mine site
item.description: Suspected space debris is believed to have crashed near a WA mine site, with the Australian Transport Safety Bureau confirming the object was not from a commercial aircraft.

item.title: Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe wins Radio National's Top 100 Books of the 21st century
item.description: The results are in — Trent Dalton's Boy Swallows Universe has won Radio National's inaugural Top 100 Books of the 21st Century.

item.title: Australia's Matthew Hauser claims World Triathlon Championship Series crown with Wollongong victory
item.description: Australia's Matthew Hauser finishes on top of the men's World Triathlon Championship Series standings following his victory on home soil.

item.title: Former March for Australia organiser shut down at latest anti-racism rally
item.description: The organiser of the first March for Australia rally in Adelaide has distanced himself from that movement, attending a counter-protest on Sunday and declaring that "racism just has no place in Australia".

item.title: Papua New Guinea canonises country's first Catholic saint
item.description: Papua New Guinea has canonised its first saint after Pope Francis approved the canonisation of local preacher Peter ToRot.

item.title: Thieves armed with chainsaws steal jewellery from the Louvre Museum in Paris
item.description: The Louvre said it was closing for the day "for exceptional reasons", but was not immediately available for comment.
